options.option: A version control system
A web-based platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories
An integrated development environment
A programming language

question.answer: A web-based platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories

question.text: Question 2: What is the main purpose of GitHub?

options.option: To provide a centralized location for storing and managing Git repositories
To compile and execute code
To design user interfaces
To manage databases

question.answer: To provide a centralized location for storing and managing Git repositories

question.text: Question 3: What is a repository in GitHub?

options.option: A storage location for GitHub configuration files
A remote server where GitHub projects are hosted
A directory that contains a Git project
A file that stores GitHub commit history

question.answer: A directory that contains a Git project

question.text: Question 4: How do you create a new repository in GitHub?

options.option: By using the "git create" command
By clicking the "New" button on the GitHub website
By running the "git init" command on your local machine
By sending a request to GitHub support

question.answer: By clicking the "New" button on the GitHub website

question.text: Question 5: What is a pull request in GitHub?

options.option: A request to merge changes from a branch to the main branch
A command to retrieve the latest changes from a remote repository
A command to revert changes in a GitHub repository
A feature to request code reviews from other developers

question.answer: A request to merge changes from a branch to the main branch

question.text: Question 6: What is the purpose of forking a repository in GitHub?

options.option: To create a personal copy of a repository for making changes without affecting the original
To optimize code execution in GitHub projects
To generate code documentation from GitHub comments
To handle user authentication and authorization in GitHub projects

question.answer: To create a personal copy of a repository for making changes without affecting the original

question.text: Question 7: What is an issue in GitHub?

options.option: A feature to track and discuss problems, enhancements, or questions related to a repository
A command to rename files in a GitHub repository
A file that contains GitHub configuration settings
A command to merge branches in GitHub

question.answer: A feature to track and discuss problems, enhancements, or questions related to a repository

question.text: Question 8: How do you clone a repository in GitHub?

options.option: By using the "git clone" command
By downloading a ZIP file from the GitHub website
By running the "git init" command on your local machine
By sending a request to the repository owner

question.text: Question 9: What is the purpose of GitHub Actions?

options.option: To automate tasks and workflows in a GitHub repository
To optimize database performance in GitHub projects
To handle user authentication and authorization in GitHub projects
To enhance user interface design in GitHub repositories

question.answer: To automate tasks and workflows in a GitHub repository

question.text: Question 10: What is the GitHub feature that allows you to track changes to a repository over time?

options.option: Git History
Git Timeline
Git Logs
Git Commits
